info.title: Humanloop API
info.description:
The Humanloop API allows you to interact with Humanloop from your product or service.

You can do this through HTTP requests from any language or via our official Python SDK.

To install the official Python SDK, run the following command:

```bash
pip install humanloop
```

---

Guides and further details about key concepts can be found in [our docs](https://humanloop.gitbook.io/humanloop-docs/).

post.description:
Creates a new project with the provided name.

An error will be raised if the user is already associated to a project with
that name.

parameters.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

schema.title: Project ID
schema.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

parameters.name: id

patch.description:
Update the project with the specified ID.

Set the project's active model config/experiment by passing either
`active_experiment_id` or `active_model_config_id`.

Set the feedback labels to be treated as positive user feedback used in
calculating top-level project metrics by passing a list of labels in
`positive_labels`.

parameters.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

schema.title: Project ID
schema.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

parameters.name: id

get.description: Get an array of model_configs associated to your project

parameters.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

schema.title: Project ID
schema.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

parameters.name: id

schema.title: Response Get Project Model Configs Projects  Id  Model Configs Get

get.description:
Retrieves a model config to use to execute your model.

A model config will be selected based on the project's
active model config/experiment settings.

parameters.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

schema.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

parameters.name: id

delete.description:
Remove the project's active model config, if set.

This has no effect if the project does not have an active model config set.

parameters.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

schema.title: Project ID
schema.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

parameters.name: id

delete.description:
Remove the project's active experiment, if set.

This has no effect if the project does not have an active experiment set.

parameters.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

schema.title: Project ID
schema.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

parameters.name: id

patch.description:
Update feedback types.

Allows creation of the default feedback types and setting status of
feedback types/categorical values.

This behaves like an upsert; any feedback categorical values that do not
already exist in the project will be created.

parameters.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

schema.title: Project ID
schema.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

parameters.name: id

post.description:
Export all logged datapoints associated to your project.

Results are paginated and sorts the datapoints based on `created_at` in
descending order.

schema.description: Page size for pagination. Number of logs to export.

parameters.name: size

post.description:
Generates an output from your model and automatically logs the results for feedback later.

The model config used for the generation depends on what parameters were specified. The 4 different behaviours, and the required parameters for each are listed below:

1. `model_config`:
    - The specific model config parameters will be used to link to an existing or create a new model config that will be used for this generation.
    - E.g. `{ "model_config": { "model: "text-davinci-002", "prompt_template", "parameters", ... } }`
2. `model_config_id`:
    - The ID of an existing model config to be used.
    - E.g. `{ "model_config_id": "config_abcdef1234567" }`
3. `experiment_id`:
    - The ID of an existing experiment. A model config will be sampled from the experiment's list of active model configs.
    - E.g. `{ "experiment_id": "exp_abcdef1234567" }`
4. `project`:
    - A model config will be selected based on the project's deployment settings.
    - E.g. `{ "project": "your-project-name-001" }`


These signatures have been listed in decreasing priority. If multiple signatures are satisfied, the highest priority signature will be used.
For example, if both `model_config` and `experiment_id` are provided, the `model_config`  will be used and the `experiment_id` will be ignored.


Note that all of the above signatures also require the following parameters: `project`, `inputs`, `source`, and `provider_api_keys`.
Additionally, the following parameters are supported: `num_samples`, `logprobs`, `suffix`, `user`, and `metadata`.
Log a datapoint or array of datapoints to your Humanloop project.
Submit a list of feedback for existing `data_ids`

Register a model config to a project and optionally add it to an
experiment.

If the project provided does not exist, a new project will be created
automatically.
If an experiment name is provided, the specified experiment must already
exist. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

If the model config is the first to be associated to the project, it will
be set as the active model config.

parameters.description: String ID of the model config. Starts with `config_`.

schema.title: Model config ID
schema.description: String ID of the model config. Starts with `config_`.

parameters.name: id

post.description:
Create an experiment for your project.

You can optionally specify IDs of your project's model configs to include
in the experiment, along with a set of labels to consider as positive feedback
and whether the experiment should be set as active.

parameters.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

schema.title: Project ID
schema.description: String ID of project. Starts with `pr_`.

parameters.name: project_id

get.description: Get all Humanloop provided tool specifications

schema.title: Response Get Tool Specs Tools Get

id.title: API key ID
id.description: String ID of API key. Starts with `key_`. This is an ID that can be used to revoke keys, and is not the key itself.

name.title: API key name
name.description: Displayed name of the generated API key.

api_key.title: API key
api_key.description: The API key. This is censored and will only contain a few leading and trailing characters.

organization_id.title: Organization ID
organization_id.description: String ID of organization that the API key belongs to. Starts with `org_`.

created_by.title: Created by
created_by.description: The user that created the API key.

last_used.title: Last used
last_used.description: The most recent time the API key was used to authenticate a request.

id.title: Metric ID
id.description: ID of the metric. Starts with 'metric_'.

description.title: Metric description
description.description: A description of what the metric measures.

code.title: Metric code
code.description: Python code used to calculate a metric value on each logged datapoint.

default.title: Metric default flag
default.description: Whether the metric is a global default metric. Metrics with this flag enabled cannot be deleted or modified.

active.title: Metric active flag
active.description: If enabled, the metric is calculated for every logged datapoint.

sentiment.title: Feedback label sentiment
sentiment.description: Whether the feedback sentiment is positive or negative.

model_config_ids.title: Model config IDs
model_config_ids.description: Model configs to add to this experiment. Further model configs can be added later.

positive_labels.title: Positive labels
positive_labels.description: Feedback labels to treat as positive user feedback. Used to monitor the performance of model configs in the experiment.

set_active.title: Set as project's active experiment
set_active.description: Whether to set the created project as the project's active experiment.

id.title: Datapoint ID
id.description: String ID of logged datapoint. Starts with `data_`.

project_id.title: Project ID
project_id.description: String ID of project the experiment belongs to. Starts with `pr_`.

name.title: Metric name
name.description: Name of the metric to be created.

description.title: Metric description
description.description: Description of the metric to be created.

code.title: Metric code
code.description: Python code used to calculate a metric value on each logged datapoint. The last defined function in the code block will be called with a `log` dict, and should return a number, or `None`.

name.title: Tool name
name.description: Organizations name for the tool. If not provided, the spec name will be used

func_name.title: Function name
func_name.description: Name of the function as it called

description.title: Tool description
description.description: Organization's description for the tool. If not provided, the spec description will be used

setup_values.title: Tool setup values
setup_values.description: Any setup values needed to set the tool as active - retrieve what setup values are required from GET on v3/tools

status.title: Tool status
status.description: Whether the tool has been set up by the org.

spec.title: Spec name
spec.description: Unique name of tool spec. Retrieve from GET on /v3/tools

id.title: Data ID
id.description: Unique ID for the model inputs and output logged to Humanloop. Use this when recording feedback later.

index.title: Sample index
index.description: The index for the sampled generation for a given input. The num_samples request parameter controls how many samples are generated.

output.title: Sanitized output text
output.description: Output text returned from the provider model with leading and trailing whitespaces stripped.

raw_output.title: Provider's output text
raw_output.description: Raw output text returned from the provider model.

inputs.title: Inputs
inputs.description: The inputs passed to the prompt template to send to provider model.

finish_reason.title: Finish reason
finish_reason.description: Why the completion ended. Usually one of 'stop' (indicating a stop token was encountered), or 'length' (indicating the max tokens limit has been reached). It will be set as null for the intermediary responses during a stream, and will only be set as non-null for the final streamed token.

model_config_id.title: The ID of your model configuration
model_config_id.description: The model configuration used to create the generation.

tools.title: Tool results
tools.description: Results of any tools run during the generation.

project.title: Project name
project.description: Unique project name. The model configuration will be added to the project if necessary.

inputs.title: Model input data
inputs.description: List of name, value pairs for the inputs used by your prompt template, or directly by your model.

source.title: Source
source.description: What was source of the model used for this generation?e.g. website-landing-page

provider_api_keys.title: Provider API Keys
provider_api_keys.description: API keys required by each provider to make API calls. These API keys are not stored by Humanloop.

num_samples.title: Number of samples
num_samples.description: How many generations to make for each set of inputs. Each generate will sample a model config for an experiment.

logprobs.title: Log probabilities of most likely n tokens
logprobs.description: Include the log probabilities of the top n tokens in the provider_response

stream.title: Whether to stream partial results
stream.description: If true, tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available. If num_samples > 1, samples are streamed back independently. The stream for each sample will be terminated with a non-null finish_reason.

suffix.title: Completion suffix
suffix.description: The suffix that comes after a completion of inserted text. Useful for completions that act like inserts.

user.title: End-user identifier
user.description: End-user id passed through to provider call.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Any additional metadata that you would like to log for reference.

experiment_id.title: ID of experiment
experiment_id.description: If an experiment ID is provided a model configuration will be sampled from the experiments active model configurations.

mean.title: Mean of experiment's metric
mean.description: The mean performance of the model config, as measured by the experiment's metric.

spread.title: Spread of experiment's metric
spread.description: The spread of performance of the model config, as measured by the experiment's metric. A measure of the uncertainty in the model config's performance.

trials_count.title: The number of trials that have happened in this experiment
trials_count.description: Number of datapoints with feedback associated to this experiment.

active.title: Model config active
active.description: Whether the model config is active in the experiment. Only active model configs can be sampled from the experiment.

id.title: Model config ID
id.description: String ID of model config. Starts with `config_`.

display_name.title: Display name
display_name.description: Display name of model config. If this is not set by the user, a friendly name will be generated.

model_config.title: Model config
model_config.description: Full definition of model config used in the experiment.

id.title: Experiment ID
id.description: String ID of experiment. Starts with `exp_`.

project_id.title: Project ID
project_id.description: String ID of project the experiment belongs to. Starts with `pr_`.

model_configs.title: Experiment model configs
model_configs.description: List of model configs associated to the experiment.

metric.title: Experiment metric
metric.description: Metric used as the experiment's objective.

positive_labels.title: Positive labels
positive_labels.description: Feedback labels to treat as positive user feedback. Used to monitor the performance of model configs in the experiment.

type.title: Feedback type
type.description: The type of feedback. The default feedback types available are 'rating', 'action', 'issue', 'correction', and 'comment'.

value.title: Feedback value
value.description: The feedback value to set. This would be the appropriate text for 'correction' or 'comment', or a label to apply for 'rating', 'action', or 'issue'.

data_id.title: Datapoint ID
data_id.description: ID to associate the feedback to a previously logged datapoint.When providing instant feedback as part of the hl.log(...) call you don't need to provide a data_id.

user.title: User
user.description: A unique identifier to who provided the feedback. This gets passed through to the provider as required.

created_at.title: Created at
created_at.description: Timestamp for when the feedback was created. If not provided, the time the call was made will be used as a timestamp.

type.title: Feedback type
type.description: The type of feedback. The default feedback types available are 'rating', 'action', 'issue', 'correction', and 'comment'.

value.title: Feedback value
value.description: The feedback value to be set. This field should be left blank when unsetting 'rating', 'correction' or 'comment', but is required otherwise.

data_id.title: Datapoint ID
data_id.description: ID to associate the feedback to a previously logged datapoint.When providing instant feedback as part of the hl.log(...) call you don't need to provide a data_id.

user.title: User
user.description: A unique identifier to who provided the feedback. This gets passed through to the provider as required.

created_at.title: Created at
created_at.description: Timestamp for when the feedback was created. If not provided, the time the call was made will be used as a timestamp.

unset.title: Unset
unset.description: If true, the value for this feedback type is unset.

type.title: Feedback type
type.description: The type of feedback. The default feedback types available are 'rating', 'action', 'issue', 'correction', and 'comment'.

value.title: Feedback value
value.description: The feedback value to set. This would be the appropriate text for 'correction' or 'comment', or a label to apply for 'rating', 'action', or 'issue'.

data_id.title: Datapoint ID
data_id.description: ID to associate the feedback to a previously logged datapoint.When providing instant feedback as part of the hl.log(...) call you don't need to provide a data_id.

user.title: User
user.description: A unique identifier to who provided the feedback. This gets passed through to the provider as required.

created_at.title: Created at
created_at.description: Timestamp for when the feedback was created. If not provided, the time the call was made will be used as a timestamp.

id.title: Feedback ID
id.description: String ID of user feedback. Starts with `ann_`, short for annotation.

type.title: Feedback type
type.description: The type of feedback. The default feedback types available are 'rating', 'action', 'issue', 'correction', and 'comment'.

values.title: Allowed values for categorical feedback types
values.description: The allowed values for categorical feedback types. Not populated for `correction` and `comment`.

type.title: Feedback type
type.description: The type of feedback to update.

values.title: Feedback label values
values.description: The feedback values to be available. This field should only be populated when updating a 'select' or 'multi_select' feedback class.

class.title: Feedback class
class.description: The data type associated to this feedback type; whether it is a 'text'/'select'/'multi_select'. This is optional when updating the default feedback types (i.e. when `type` is 'rating', 'action' or 'issue').

project_id.title: Project id
project_id.description: Unique identifier of the parent project.

num_samples.title: Number of samples
num_samples.description: How many generates to make for each set of inputs.

logprobs.title: Log probabilities of most likely n tokens
logprobs.description: Include the log probabilities of the top n tokens in the provider_response

suffix.title: Completion suffix
suffix.description: The suffix that comes after a completion of inserted text. Useful for completions that act like inserts.

user.title: End-user identifier
user.description: End-user id passed through to provider call.

data.title: Logged data
data.description: Array containing the details of the resulting generations.

usage.title: Usage
usage.description: Counts of the number of tokens used and related stats.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Any additional metadata that you would like to log for reference.

provider_responses.title: Provider responses
provider_responses.description: The full raw responses provided by the calls to the provider.

prompt_tokens.title: Prompt tokens
prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens used in the prompt.

generation_tokens.title: Generation tokens
generation_tokens.description: Number of tokens produced by the generation.

total_tokens.title: Total tokens
total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used by the prompt and generation combined.

GetModelConfigResponse.title: GetModelConfigResponse

provider.title: Model provider
provider.description: The company providing the underlying model service.

endpoint.title: Provider endpoint
endpoint.description: Which of the providers model endpoints to use. For example Complete or Edit.

model.title: Model instance used
model.description: What model instance to use for the generation. e.g. text-davinci-002.

prompt_template.title: Prompt template
prompt_template.description: Prompt template that will take your specified inputs to form your final request to the provider model. NB: Input variables within the prompt template should be specified with syntax: {{INPUT_NAME}}.

temperature.title: Sampling temperature
temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use when making a generation. Higher values means the model will be more creative.

max_tokens.title: Maximum tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

top_p.title: Top p probability mass
top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass.

stop.title: Stop sequence(s)
stop.description: The string (or list of strings) after which the model will stop generating. The returned text will not contain the stop sequence.

presence_penalty.title: Penalize tokens on whether present.
presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the generation so far.

frequency_penalty.title: Penalize tokens on whether frequent.
frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on how frequently they appear in the generation so far.

other.title: Other provider parameters
other.description: Other parameter values to be passed to the provider call.

id.title: Model config ID
id.description: Model config unique identifier generated by Humanloop.

display_name.title: Model config name
display_name.description: A friendly display name for the model config.

project_id.title: Project ID
project_id.description: String ID of project the model config belongs to. Starts with `pr_`.

project_name.title: Project name
project_name.description: Name of the project the model config belongs to.

experiment_id.title: Experiment ID
experiment_id.description: The ID of the experiment the model config has been registered to. Only populated when registering a model config to an experiment.

trial_id.title: Trial ID
trial_id.description: ID of trial to reference in subsequent log calls.

GetModelConfigResponse.description:
A selected model configuration.

If the model configuration was selected in the context of an experiment,
the response will include a trial_id to associate a subsequent log() call.

LabelSentiment.title: LabelSentiment
LabelSentiment.description:
How a label should be treated in calculating model config performance.

Used by a project's PAPV metric.

project.title: Project name
project.description: Unique project name. If it does not exist, a new project will be created.

trial_id.title: Trial ID
trial_id.description: Unique ID of trial to associate to a log to inform an experiment.

inputs.title: Model input data
inputs.description: List of (name, value) pairs for the inputs used by your prompt template, or directly by your model.

output.title: Model output
output.description: Generated output from your model for the provided inputs.

source.title: Source of generation
source.description: What was source of the model used for this generation? e.g. website-landing-page

model_config.title: Model config
model_config.description: The model config used for this generation. Required unless `trial_id` is provided.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Any additional metadata that you would like to log for reference.

feedback.title: Feedback labels
feedback.description: Optional parameter to provide feedback with your logged datapoint.

created_at.title: Created at
created_at.description: Timestamp for when the log was created. If not provided, the time the log call was made will be used as a timestamp.

project.title: Project name
project.description: Unique project name. If it does not exist, a new project will be created.

trial_id.title: Trial ID
trial_id.description: Unique ID of trial to associate to a log to inform an experiment.

inputs.title: Model input data
inputs.description: List of (name, value) pairs for the inputs used by your prompt template, or directly by your model.

output.title: Model output
output.description: Generated output from your model for the provided inputs.

source.title: Source of generation
source.description: What was source of the model used for this generation? e.g. website-landing-page

model_config.title: Model config
model_config.description: The model config used for this generation

created_at.title: Created at
created_at.description: Timestamp for when the log was created.

id.title: Datapoint ID
id.description: String ID of logged datapoint. Starts with `data_`.

project_id.title: Project ID
project_id.description: String ID of project the datapoint belongs to. Starts with `pr_`.

id.title: Experiment ID
id.description: String ID of experiment. Starts with `exp_`.

id.title: Metric ID
id.description: ID of the metric. Starts with 'metric_'.

description.title: Metric description
description.description: A description of what the metric measures.

code.title: Metric code
code.description: Python code used to calculate a metric value on each logged datapoint.

default.title: Metric default flag
default.description: Whether the metric is a global default metric. Metrics with this flag enabled cannot be deleted or modified.

active.title: Metric active flag
active.description: If enabled, the metric is calculated for every logged datapoint.

experiments.title: Experiments using the metric
experiments.description: List of experiments optimizing for this metric.

num_values.title: Number of values
num_values.description: Number of datapoints this metric has been calculated on. This does not include datapoints where the metric returned `None`.

project.title: Project name
project.description: Unique project name. The model configuration will be added to the project if necessary.

inputs.title: Model input data
inputs.description: List of name, value pairs for the inputs used by your prompt template, or directly by your model.

source.title: Source
source.description: What was source of the model used for this generation?e.g. website-landing-page

provider_api_keys.title: Provider API Keys
provider_api_keys.description: API keys required by each provider to make API calls. These API keys are not stored by Humanloop.

num_samples.title: Number of samples
num_samples.description: How many generations to make for each set of inputs for the specified model config.

logprobs.title: Log probabilities of most likely n tokens
logprobs.description: Include the log probabilities of the top n tokens in the provider_response

stream.title: Whether to stream partial results
stream.description: If true, tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available. If num_samples > 1, samples are streamed back independently. The stream for each sample will be terminated with a non-null finish_reason.

suffix.title: Completion suffix
suffix.description: The suffix that comes after a completion of inserted text. Useful for completions that act like inserts.

user.title: End-user identifier
user.description: End-user id passed through to provider call.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Any additional metadata that you would like to log for reference.

model_config_id.title: ID of a model config
model_config_id.description: The model configuration specified will be used to create a generation.

ModelConfigRequest.title: ModelConfigRequest

provider.title: Model provider
provider.description: The company providing the underlying model service.

endpoint.title: Provider endpoint
endpoint.description: Which of the providers model endpoints to use. For example Complete or Edit.

model.title: Model instance used
model.description: What model instance to use for the generation. e.g. text-davinci-002.

prompt_template.title: Prompt template
prompt_template.description: Prompt template that will take your specified inputs to form your final request to the provider model. NB: Input variables within the prompt template should be specified with syntax: {{INPUT_NAME}}.

temperature.title: Sampling temperature
temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use when making a generation. Higher values means the model will be more creative.

max_tokens.title: Maximum tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

top_p.title: Top p probability mass
top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass.

stop.title: Stop sequence(s)
stop.description: The string (or list of strings) after which the model will stop generating. The returned text will not contain the stop sequence.

presence_penalty.title: Penalize tokens on whether present.
presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the generation so far.

frequency_penalty.title: Penalize tokens on whether frequent.
frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on how frequently they appear in the generation so far.

other.title: Other provider parameters
other.description: Other parameter values to be passed to the provider call.

Following closely: https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions/create

slug.title: Organization unique slug
slug.description: A unique slug that will be used for the organization. Only accepts letters, numbers, and hyphens.

id.title: Organization ID
id.description: String ID of organization. Starts with `org_`.

active_subscription.title: Active subscription
active_subscription.description: The active subscription of the organization including product information. If None the org has no active subscription.

customer_id.title: Stripe customer ID

setup_values.description: Values used to set up the tool - following the spec's setup model.

description.title: Description

setup_spec.title: Setup arguments spec
setup_spec.description: Field definitions for the setup (i.e. init) arguments that the tool needs - e.g api_key

run_spec.description: Field definitions for the run arguments the tool needs - e.g query

func_name.title: Name of callable
func_name.description: Unique name to use when running tool.

signature.title: Signature
signature.description: The function signature of the tool when being called.

positive_labels.title: Positive labels
positive_labels.description: Feedback labels to treat as positive user feedback. Used to monitor the performance of model configs in the experiment.

config_ids_to_register.title: Model config IDs to register
config_ids_to_register.description: Model configs to add to this experiment.

config_ids_to_deregister.title: Model config IDs to deregister

description.description: A description of what the metric measures.

code.description: Python code used to calculate a metric value on each logged datapoint.

active.title: Metric active flag
active.description: If enabled, the metric is calculated for every logged datapoint.

name.description: Organizations name for the tool. If not provided, the spec name will be used

func_name.title: Function name
func_name.description: Name of the function as it called

description.title: Tool description
description.description: Organization's description for the tool. If not provided, the spec description will be used

setup_values.title: Tool setup values
setup_values.description: Any setup values needed to set the tool as active - retrieve what setup values are required from GET on v3/tools

status.title: Tool status
status.description: Whether the tool has been set up by the org.

slug.description: A unique slug that will be used for the organization. Only accepts letters, numbers, and hyphens.

positive_labels.title: List of feedback labels to consider as positive actions
positive_labels.description: The full list of labels to treat as positive user feedback.

APIKeyHeader.name: X-API-KEY
APIKeyHeader.description:
The Humanloop API uses API keys for authentication. Visit your 
[User Settings](https://app.humanloop.com/llama/settings) page to retrieve the
API key you'll use in your requests.

This key allows full access and control over your projects, so keep this secret
and take care to not expose it in any client-side code.

To use your API key, include it under the `X-API-KEY` header in your HTTP request.

```bash
curl https://api.humanloop.com/v3/projects -H 'X-API-KEY: YOUR_API_KEY'
```

If you're using the Python SDK, initialize the client with your API key before
using other SDK methods:

```python
hl.init(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
```

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
The Humanloop API uses API keys for authentication. Visit your 
[User Settings](https://app.humanloop.com/llama/settings) page to retrieve the
API key you'll use in your requests.

This key allows full access and control over your projects, so keep this secret
and take care to not expose it in any client-side code.

To use your API key, include it under the `X-API-KEY` header in your HTTP request.

```bash
curl https://api.humanloop.com/v3/projects -H 'X-API-KEY: YOUR_API_KEY'
```

If you're using the Python SDK, initialize the client with your API key before
using other SDK methods:

```python
hl.init(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
```
